website_summaries.verdict: It's resemblance to traditional peanut butter makes Barney's an easy way to make a healthy transition.
pros: The texture and consistency is similar to traditional processed peanut butter
So if you're looking to swap out the old peanut butter for a healthier option, Barney's will be an easy transition
The consistency and flavor also make it perfect for baking
cons: Uses a large amount of palm oil

customer_reviews.title: In the ingredients Barney conveniently took out. Palm Fruit Oil but its there. Look at my picture
customer_reviews.text: Barney Butter has wrongfully and illegally advertised this there products for more sales. This Almond Butter contains 78% Palm Fruit Oil. Almonds need to be listed last on the ingredients.
customer_reviews.author: Donald

customer_reviews.title: Nutrition label is not accurate
customer_reviews.text: The nutrition label shown in the official photo is incorrect. It states 6g carbs and 4g fiber (resulting in 2g net carbs). The product I actually received however showed 7g carbs and 4g fiber (3g net carbs) on the label. This may seem insignificant but it is a big deal for someone on a keto diet.
customer_reviews.author: Joey

customer_reviews.title: Tastes like peanut butter
customer_reviews.text: If you want your almond butter to taste like peanut butter, then buy this product. Also, why palm oil? Did they siphon off the almond oil to sell separately? Awful product.
customer_reviews.author: Sharon Dolin

customer_reviews.title: great taste! Prior to this I was using a ...
customer_reviews.text: Creamy, doesn't separate, great taste! Prior to this I was using a natural peanut butter but I decided to switch to almonds to get a calcium boost easily, First I tried a store brand and found out it was full of sugar. This product has no added sugar. Plus the Amazon price is half the price of the same product at my local grocery store!
customer_reviews.author: Doc Y

customer_reviews.title: The best almond butter
customer_reviews.text: This almond butter is absolutely delicious. I love that there’s no added salt or sugar. The consistency is very smooth and creamy (photo attached), and the taste is fantastic. I put this one on subscribe & save to make sure i wouldn’t run out!
customer_reviews.author: HappyMama

customer_reviews.title: Pricey but the best almond butter by far
customer_reviews.text: This is a very good almond butter that I have found to be better in quality than the other spreads. It's creamy, not gritty. It says no stir but sometimes my jar has product separation with oil on top. I don't mind stirring it when this happens..and it's a good idea to stir from the bottom. If not, you may find that it's harder to spread by the time you get to the bottom of the jar. It does cost more but for taste and quality it can't be beat.
customer_reviews.author: Jaie

customer_reviews.title: Needs a glass jar & no palm oil....
customer_reviews.text: I think this almond butter is really yummy. As I continue to develop my knowledge about palm oil and reducing plastic waste, I would like this company to consider finding a healthy alternative to palm oil and using a glass jar.
customer_reviews.author: Gina

customer_reviews.title: The only one I buy now...
customer_reviews.text: If you've wanted the healthy choice of almond butter but didn't like the grittiness of most butters out there, try this. Great flavor and very smooth.
customer_reviews.author: Susan A.

customer_reviews.title: great nut butter!!!
customer_reviews.text: needed to cut out a number of things from my diet because they caused muscle inflammation. one of them was peanuts. I loved reeses and made my own 'crunchy'. tried walnut, sunflower, cashew etc butters all of which agreed w/me but after I tried this I made it my 'go to'. only put it on bread 2 times. out of the jar and into the mouth it goes (I live alone so double triple quadruple dipping is ok)!! TRY SOME!! its good and thick and peanut buttery textured for your pleasure filled consumption!!!! gonna go dip some RIGHT NOW!!!!!! YYYUUUMMMMMMMM!!!!
customer_reviews.author: DHminnesota

customer_reviews.title: Too oily tasting no rich chocolate flavor here. .
customer_reviews.text: Reminded me of the Jif cashew butter where you could taste more of the oil flavor than the almonds or the cocoa...if you are looking for something similar to Nutella, this is nowhere near the richness and barely tastes of almonds or chocolate...skip it and just buy the regular Barney butter--at least you can taste the nuttiness in that one although wish they would just use almond oil instead of palm since it is so expensive anyway...
customer_reviews.author: A. Thankful

customer_reviews.title: Better Almond Butter
customer_reviews.text: Love this almond butter! My local stores have been out of Barney Butter Crunch Almond Butter for a few months now, and I was desperate! My friend Amazon to the rescue! The difference here is the taste - hands down a better taste than any of the other premium almond butters. And... no mixing! Most almond butters have a layer of oil on top that you need to vigorously mix into the container... if you don't the bottom is like cement. Not Barney Butter. Thanks Amazon to the rescue, almond butter crisis averted.
customer_reviews.author: Laura @ Island Paws Studio

customer_reviews.title: YUCK
customer_reviews.text: My husband eats almond butter like there is no tomorrow and we have tried many brands. This is by far the worst...so bad, in fact, it is going in the trash. It doesn't smell or taste like almond butter. I really want to like it because the price is great, but, well, 'nuff said.
customer_reviews.author: keeting

customer_reviews.title: Yuck
customer_reviews.text: I hoped this "Bare" blanched almond butter would work but I was very disappointed. To my taste, it was artificial in almost waxy texture - too much palm oil?. At least Barney's say their goal was to use 100% sustainable palm oil by the end of 2015. Hope that is the case. Taste wasn't good either. I'll pass.
customer_reviews.author: Suz M

customer_reviews.title: OMG No... this made my family and I almost puke in synchronization.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this because of the "no sugar added" label and man, do I regret it. I had made sugar free chocolate and AB cups for the family (I am trying to show them that it is possible to live sugar free) we all bit into them and almost puked. I don't know if it's just the one I received or not but it was very waxy tasting. It wasn't expired either. I thought the amount of oil was normal but after reading other reviews perhaps it's not. Also, palm oil is used and that might be leading to the wax taste.
customer_reviews.author: Cameron Teague

customer_reviews.title: After opening it, I thought I had gotten peanut butter by accident
customer_reviews.text: No almond taste. Really bland flavor. When I opened it, I thought it was peanut butter. I hadn't realized there was added sugar and oil. Not buying again. This should definitely be labeled more clearly as sugar added. This is basically the Jiffy of almond butter. Industrial, tasteless junk. Not recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Soren Dayton

customer_reviews.title: So wonderful! I love it!
customer_reviews.text: I absolutely love this stuff. I never thought I'd like something better than peanut butter, but I was wrong. It is so decadent that it fulfills my cravings for desserts. I am sugar free and keto, but I do add Himalayan pink salt to it and it is the best. I believe the blanched skinned almonds is what makes it taste so good. No bitterness at all. Be aware, there are different sizes, and the 16 oz is like the size of a peanut butter jar if you want a big size. I am on my 4th jar. I also love the dipping cups for work. They are the perfect snack size at 1 oz for a 173 calorie snack.
customer_reviews.author: Jill Rhoden

customer_reviews.title: Great Substitute for Peanut Butter
customer_reviews.text: I love Peanut Butter but my son has a severe allergy. This is a great substitute for peanut butter. I have tried many products and this comes the closest to tasting like peanut butter without the risk of cross contamination.
customer_reviews.author: Maya

customer_reviews.title: Tastes great
customer_reviews.text: Love this, it's the first nut butter I have tried but I will stick with this one.
customer_reviews.author: Shannon Leigh

customer_reviews.title: Best ever!
customer_reviews.text: What can I say? Barney butter rocks and this was a better price than in the store. I see in the store and think “Barney you got some nerve charging that much”. It’s the best almond butter out there and amazon is best place to buy it
customer_reviews.author: D. Braidman

customer_reviews.title: A lumpy mess!!
customer_reviews.text: I usually buy the smaller jar at our local Foodlion and it is always creamy and less oily. This is something totally different. Lumpy and dry with separated oil in-between. I tried to mix it but the limbs remain. It's a jucky mess at best. It may have been a fluke but at that price I'm not taking another chance. Sorry
customer_reviews.author: KJ

customer_reviews.title: Contains palm oil!
customer_reviews.text: Beware, If you read the list of ingredients you will see that this almond butter contains palm oil! Whether or not you are concerned with the health risk there is no doubt that the production of palm oil is an environmental disaster. As its use is becoming more common rainforest habitat is being destroyed. Palm oil production is particularly harmful to orangutans as well as elephants and other rainforest animals. Please do not buy, there are other delicious and creamy almond butters that are free of palm oil.
customer_reviews.author: GratefulinGulfport

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't really taste like almond butter--It's awful!!
customer_reviews.text: I have been eating almond butter for years. This doesn't really taste like almond butter. There is an odd thick texture that is never normally seen in real almond butter. I ordered it without checking the ingredients carefully. I have eaten so many brands of almond butter over the years, that I never imagined anyone would pack it with palm oil. I just thought I was ordering real almond butter like I have so many times before from other companies--It's awful tasting!!! ---Whoever decided to add palm oil to something so perfect as crushed almonds is really crazy!!
customer_reviews.author: Margaret Ware

customer_reviews.title: Not 100% almond butter
customer_reviews.text: It's very smooth and mixable so I looked at ingredients. I thought it was 100% almond butter. It is not. There is 'palm fruit oil' in it, which I am sure gives it the smoothness and spreadability that some might be looking for. It also doesn't separate as much as standard almond butter. So if you are looking for those things, it is great. If you want 100% almond butter...not so much.
customer_reviews.author: CZ

customer_reviews.title: Taste is not popping, but reasonable
customer_reviews.text: I have consumed nut butters of various brands for a long time and dearly love them. Usually I find they are similar in taste and viscosity (thickness, consistency). As suggested in the above headline, the flavor is a little lacking; a bit bland on the nut and chocolate taste. My major objection is the viscosity. The butter was extremely dry and hard, virtually impossible to spread without ripping the bread (or whatever) to pieces. Almost like an old dried out product. I have ordered the Barney Butter Almond Butter, Bare Smooth, 16 Ounce product and hopefully it will prove to be a much better product.
customer_reviews.author: Frog

customer_reviews.title: Not for me - bland as glue
customer_reviews.text: I love almonds. I adore them. I also love peanut butter. I thought this would be a healthier option. It surely is and I did expect it to taste different without the added sugar and salt, but I wasn’t expecting it to taste like, well, glue. Or at least what I think glue might taste like. It was creamy and looked delicious, and smelled delicious, but no flavor at all. I tried mixing it up, I tried it on different things, but it just was like a flavorless paste. So if you have never had saltless sugarless almond butter before and you love peanut butter, this might not be for you.
customer_reviews.author: Kristi

customer_reviews.title: Too expensive for what it is
customer_reviews.text: Jar arrived dented, then when I opened the container, there was a large air pocket inside and once product removed to make the recipe I needed it for, it barely gave me over a cup of product... laughable that this was marked a 16 oz. jar of almond butter. I will stick with Trader Joe's.
customer_reviews.author: Beach Lover  (Sue)

customer_reviews.title: Contains Sugar and Palm Oil
customer_reviews.text: I was so excited to find an almond butter without the skin, I must've gotten careless in my research of this product. I was quite dismayed to find that it contains not just palm oil, but sugar! Anyone, like myself, who likes the taste of almonds does not need the flavor enhanced with sugar. I don't need or want the sugar. They added palm oil ?. The result is a consistency like it has been refrigerated without actually having served time in the refrigerator and not as easily spread. Should be soft and run off the end of the spoon.
customer_reviews.author: Joluma

customer_reviews.title: My goto for "Instant" Almond Milk
customer_reviews.text: I make homemade almond milk both for convenience and cost effectiveness and Barney Butter makes the best flavored milk at the best price break I have found yet. Just 2 tablespoons of butter, a teaspoon of sugar (maple syrup is great) and a dash of salt in a jar of water and a moment of shaking it and I have a jar full of almond milk for cooking, cold cereal or drinking.
customer_reviews.author: W. Chambers

customer_reviews.title: I'm very pleased with my first jar of this.
customer_reviews.text: It is definitely crunchy with a lot of nuts in it, almost too many. It does require a little stirring, but not much. It spreads very well considering all the nuts. My only complaint is that the jar wasn't completely full. It's probably closer to 9 oz than 10. The chip people have been using that settling BS for years. Not sure how that would apply to almond butter. I'll probably try one more jar, but if it's short on quantity, I'll probably look elsewhere.
customer_reviews.author: MacTownFun

customer_reviews.title: Best almond butter ever
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely the best almond butter I have ever had! I'm not normally a fan of almond butter because it's gritty and just not that good. I changed my mind after trying Barney Bare Smooth. It is so smooth and creamy. "Bare smooth" is no exaggeration. I only ordered this as a peanut butter substitute for places where PB is not allowed but I will be ordering more because this is so delicious. It's a savory goodness!
customer_reviews.author: Soshiny

customer_reviews.title: Like Peanut Butter Cookies? Try ‘em w/Almond Butter!
customer_reviews.text: Like Peanut Butter Cookies? Try ‘em w/Almond Butter! Simply use your favorite Peanut Butter Cookie recipe, yet replace the P.B. with a good Almond Butter that’s ROASTED ALMONDS. — And don’t forget to add salt to taste in the Almond Butter! Most good (Roasted/Blanched) Almond Butter hasn’t any salt added; be forewarned: the kinds of decent Almond Butters which DO add salt, IMHO, seem to go more than a little crazy with the salt. —Caveat Emptor. You’ll find that Almond Butter Cookies are nothing shy of addicting; likely better for you, too. —Enjoy!!!
customer_reviews.author: 🌈☮️ MICHÆL IRVINE ❤️

customer_reviews.title: Warning: Contains Palm nut oil
customer_reviews.text: Yuck! Barney Almond Butter is not pure almonds but almonds and palm oil. The consistency is similar to Jif or Skippy of the past. You remember, when peanut butter was peanut lard. I should have looked past the high ratings on this one.
customer_reviews.author: Lily

customer_reviews.title: Smooth nut butter experience
customer_reviews.text: This almond butter, which is peanut free and manufactured in a dedicated facility for almonds only, is really a great product. The flavor is good, it's spreadable, etc. I usually use it as a dessert mixed with some cocoa powder, cinnamon and some honey. If you have a family member with severe nut allergies, or if you have allergies and want another source of plant based protein that is safe, you absolutely cannot go wrong with Barney branded almond butter.
customer_reviews.author: Eric S

customer_reviews.title: Do not buy this if you have no self control! Lol
customer_reviews.text: I love all of the Barney Butter products that I have tasted. I bought this one recently to try something different. OMG, it’s delicious! I’m not going to lie. I ate the whole thing in 3 days. So if you have no self control, you may not want to try this delicious stuff. I ate this stuff by the spoon, but I’m sure would be wonderful on a piece of toast. Buyers beware, this stuff is addictive!
customer_reviews.author: danyell2427

customer_reviews.title: Best almond butter ever!
customer_reviews.text: I used to hate almond butter, it was gritty and runny and oh so gross. That was until I tried Barney's. Now this is the only almond butter I'll ever buy. I adhere to an 80/20 Paleo diet and this meets my needs. There is some cane sugar present so if you are trying to avoid all sugars you need to try the Barney's "Bare" variety.
customer_reviews.author: Team Rogers

customer_reviews.title: Fabulous
customer_reviews.text: This is wonderful! No separation, easy to spread, similar texture to peanut butter. I have this on auto order now because it’s so much better than the brands I buy at the grocery. I’ve tried so many and am always disappointed that they are too oily and won’t mix up, difficult to spread, or just not yummy. This has it all. Perfection. My son has a peanut allergy so it’s been a struggle missing peanut butter for my husband and myself. This is made in a peanut free facility and checks all our boxes. Lifelong customers for sure!
customer_reviews.author: Ariane

customer_reviews.title: So-so Almond Butter
customer_reviews.text: August 30 2016 I decided to order Barney Butter Bare Almond Butter, because it was priced a few dollars less per ounce size, than the Justin's brand, that I usually order at a different vendor's website. Comparing it to Justin's, and the MaraNatha brand, I put it in third place. Hence the 3 star rating. The almond butter appears too commercial, and not homemade enough for me. It was not very almond tasting either, as compared to the 2 other brands I mentioned. Although not bad, I rate it as "so-so", and would not order it again, even if the other brands I usually buy do cost more per ounce.
customer_reviews.author: Howard

customer_reviews.title: No joke, I had to make sure "Out of sight, out of mind" was adhered to
customer_reviews.text: Took it out of the box, took the lid off, unsealed it. Was curious, because I'll admit, I bought this thinking I had bought peanut butter, but then noticed it was almond butter. So was curious about the flavor. Took a tiny spoonful, and lost it. I legit, took another two spoonfuls, and then immediately slammed the lid on it and threw it into the cabinet, because I knew if I continued, I'd plow through the whole jar. This stuff is amazing. Not too sweet, not too salty, and the texture is perfect.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew

customer_reviews.title: Love it...TOO MUCH!!! Hahaha!!
customer_reviews.text: I eat it off a soft, silicone-tipped feeding spoon while I baby my adult braces. - A great alternative to peanut butter, that I cannot eat - WIN! - No grit (like other almond butters) to get stuck in the nooks 'n crannies - WIN! - Less expensive than in my local markets - WIN! - Tastes *awesome* - WIN! - ...and we happen to have a hamster named "Barney" - ANOTHER WIN!!! 😄 WINS all over the place!!!
customer_reviews.author: Chris T.

customer_reviews.title: Yummy!  Nicer texture than other almond butters
customer_reviews.text: Love the texture! It doesn't separate like other almond butters do. It's creamier than the Marantha brand, and the color is more like that of peanut butter than that of almond butter.
customer_reviews.author: anjellyca

customer_reviews.title: Fresh Almonds that you can Spread on Toast
customer_reviews.text: This vendor/supplier gives outstanding service. The original jar of almond butter arrived with the plastic cap smashed and the inner seal leaking. I asked for a replacement and the supplier sent another jar and it was received within 5 days. My husband said that this is the best, freshest almond butter that he has ever tasted and it is like eating fresh almonds without the crunch. Will definitely purchased this product from this supplier again. Quality product at a fair price.
customer_reviews.author: Luvtoski

customer_reviews.title: Between tasteless and very unpleasant. > GAG <
customer_reviews.text: Somewhere between tasteless and unpleasant. The top of the container left plenty of room for stirring in the small amount of separated oil. The almond butter sometimes tasted like nothing at all, and sometimes tasted like very unpleasant spoiled nuts. I was in search of a very smooth almond butter with a creamy texture, and this might have fit the bill, but sadly it caused my gag reflex to kick in. I'm not sure how anyone is able to choke this down.
customer_reviews.author: ILiveOnAmazon!

customer_reviews.title: Best Almond Butter!
customer_reviews.text: This is my favorite almond butter! It's really hard to find almond butter that isn't natural (meaning the dark, bark-like husks are left on and there's no added sugar). Skippy used to make one that I loved, then they took the natural route, too. Bleh. My husband is allergic to peanuts, and I have a son allergic to sunflower butter, so almond butter is the only thing they can both have and this product is the best tasting stuff around! Thank you, Barney Butter for putting some sugar in your product so it actually tastes good and to Amazon for selling it so I can find it.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Sensational. A perfect almond butter.
customer_reviews.text: Finally!! An almond butter I can trust and love. I've tried other assorted almond butters too my great disappointment. The others were too runny (the consistency of syrup), or so heavy that it was impossible to spread. And they all required refrigeration. This brand is a marvel. Non GMO, No refrigeration required! Smooth and delightful to spread and eat. I should have ordered from Amazon in the first place!
customer_reviews.author: Van

customer_reviews.title: Hard to spread, tastes old, not sure what's wrong
customer_reviews.text: I've eaten Barney almond butter a lot and this time it is hard to get it out of the jar and spread. I'm use to having a little oil in it too mix up, but there is none and it tastes like it's old. I love the product but this one must have been a dud.
customer_reviews.author: Dia

customer_reviews.title: High in sulfites
customer_reviews.text: This stuff is high in sulfites and presumably has additives to make it smooth. If you are sensitive to sulfites, as I am, you will want to buy an organic brand instead.
customer_reviews.author: Seattle

customer_reviews.title: Best almond butter on the market!!
customer_reviews.text: Barney Butter is the best almond butter you can buy! It's expensive (like all almond butter) but the taste and texture are perfectly balanced. I don't buy any other brands. The oil doesn't separate, it's just perfect. I have to use alternative nut butters because I have a severe peanut allergy and I've tried many of the alternatives, but nothing compares to Barney Butter.
customer_reviews.author: Noelle436

customer_reviews.title: Oil Slick
customer_reviews.text: Just received my order - opened and to my surprise it's an oil slick! I stirred the jar but still the oil was overpowering the almond butter - see my photo - probably will have to spill out half of the jar of oil! Also the freshness date on the bottom of the jar is 10/3/19 so not even 3 months of freshness...must have been sitting at the back of amazon's shelf.........
customer_reviews.author: Lynda Facci

customer_reviews.title: Good stuff
customer_reviews.text: It’s a little bit thicker than peanut butter but not too hard to spread or get out of the jar. The taste is nutty, not sweet but it’s hearty and filling. It’s perfect for my low carb diet, I’m not Keto. I spread it on a 100 calorie Thomas English muffin and have half a cup of almond milk for breakfast or lunch and I’m completely satisfied, and not hungry for a long time. I’ve become addicted to it. The almond butter will now become a staple in my pantry.
customer_reviews.author: Renee

customer_reviews.title: Beware,  this item has palm oil, salt and sugar in it.
customer_reviews.text: I do not recommend this almond butter as it has sugar, salt and worst of all palm oil which is unhealthy to consume. This is not made clear in the product description but I found out when I ordered a jar and had to throw it out.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Only two ingredients, almonds and palm oil.
customer_reviews.text: Taste is okay but I was disappointed to see it contains palm oil. Palm oil is added to prevent the separation of oils so it doesn’t need to be stirred. I don’t mind stirring almond butter, I was very disappointed to see it contains palm oil. Due to this fact I won’t be buying it again.
customer_reviews.author: Jim T.

customer_reviews.title: I love the fact that there is no added sugar or ...
customer_reviews.text: I love the fact that there is no added sugar or salt in this (0mg sodium / 1 g sugar). It's a great source of protein, low carbs, but of course ... high fat. I can't eat this all of the time, but apart from getting fresh ground almond butter with NOTHING added, this is the best store bought (just blanched almonds and palm oil). I would highly recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: FitChick

customer_reviews.title: Holy grail almond butter
customer_reviews.text: Actually a seasoned almond butter reviewer here- I’ve tried many top brands and local California small scale brands. This is a smaller scale brand that produces in Fresno close to the almond tree fields. It’s very very high quality for the price, I recommend. Not too much filler crap and a smooth, tasty almond spread. Great for keto low carb stuff. Better than Costco or Trader Joe’s stuff.
customer_reviews.author: ALEX C.

customer_reviews.title: Creamy
customer_reviews.text: this is exactly what I was looking for a smooth and creamy almond butter I do not like the Justin brand because it's too grainy this is completely smooth like creamy peanut butter but being almond butter it tastes great to me you can actually tell there is no sugar so it's very natural but I'm going to put it in my health smoothie and it will be just great just what I was looking for
customer_reviews.author: Tonianne

customer_reviews.title: Very Good Almond Butter
customer_reviews.text: I took a chance on this when all the stores were out of Jiff almond butter and I really like it. I was nervous because many reviews claimed that this tastes like peanut butter. That's not entirely wrong, but it's not correct either. This was made from almonds, and I can taste the almonds. But the were salted and roasted in a way that is highly reminiscent of peanut butter. This may be why some reviewers claim it's the best almond butter ever, and others disagree.
customer_reviews.author: Christine Amsden

customer_reviews.title: No salt = No taste
customer_reviews.text: I thought this would be an ok product sine they didn't offer a salted option. It's very similar to low-fat peanut butter. I don't normally salt my food, but in this case, the missing salt makes it terrible. Unless you want to melt it, add the salt and put it back in the container to cool, it's flavorless and dry.
customer_reviews.author: Queen Bee

customer_reviews.title: Strong palm oil taste
customer_reviews.text: It was my first time trying almond butter when I bought this item off amazon. I was pretty excited for this but I don't like the taste. I cook a lot with palm oil and was surprised to find that this almond butter contains and tastes very much like palm oil. Was pretty disappointed and will have to throw this out, unfortunately. I am going to try a different brand of almond butter and will update this review if I find that palm oil is essential for good almond butter.
customer_reviews.author: Anon

customer_reviews.title: Taste & quality nut butter
customer_reviews.text: Bought 2 different brands of nut butter at same time. The 2nd brand is highly known in the nut butter world so I trusted its name, but I bought this one because of less carbs. I must say, I am highly impressed with this nut butter. I have used it on "egg waffles" and with keto icecream. Im sure it would be fabulous in protein shake! I highly recommend this product!
customer_reviews.author: Mam

customer_reviews.title: Not “no stir”
customer_reviews.text: Love the taste, very fresh, but find the “no stir” deceiving, the oil is floating on the top so you have to stir it every time before spreading. Halfway down the jar the product get harder and harder to stir just like all other natural peanut or almond butters. So if you have arthritis or don’t have very strong hands, I don’t recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Gerd Bucsko

customer_reviews.title: I returned this
customer_reviews.text: It contains palm oil, which is nowhere indicarted in the promo. Palm oil decimates Baboon habitat and rainforest habitat. Also, and likely with the addition ofthat, the almond butter flavor and texture is greatly blanded out- its sort of like Skippy with a fait almond taste- just not suitable or up to my standards. Going back to kevala.
customer_reviews.author: Rachel

customer_reviews.title: Good almond taste and easy to spread on hot toast and hot waffles
customer_reviews.text: Hola: I use my counter top oven to make toast and waffles. I place the jar beside the oven, place bread or waffles inside, and select toast. The fan from the over softens the almond butter (once opened, I keep the jar in the fridge), so it's easy to spread on the hot toast and hot waffles. I'd purchase again! Cuidate, CL
customer_reviews.author: C. L. Page

customer_reviews.title: Funny Taste
customer_reviews.text: I think this almond butter would taste much better in a recipe, which is what I'm going to do with the remainder of it. It has a very unusual taste due to how they incorporated the oil into the almond butter. I've had many almond butters before but never had one that just didn't taste 'real' to me due to this blending. I typically love to just eat it right out of the container with a spoon, but not this one! Also, I think it would taste much better with a little salt added in, but, again, this may work great in recipes!
customer_reviews.author: Linda Cobos

customer_reviews.title: Not happy
customer_reviews.text: I gave a sugar and was looking forward to eating this No Sugar Almond Butter. What I was not expecting was to having a allergic reaction. I'm not allergic to nuts. It's whatever else is in this product. I broke out in a rash the first time. Second time I tried it I broke out in big ugly red "bites", that itched and very painful. I ended up tossing the jar. Made my own from my Vitamix. No Allergic reaction.
customer_reviews.author: Mariann

customer_reviews.title: Awful!
customer_reviews.text: Reminds me of Jif or Skippy peanut butter but without any flavor at all. Just a thik lump of tasteless goo. Even worse, it contains added palm fruit oil. I LOVE almond butter, but this didn't resemble the real thing at all, and it is the first one I've tried that I actually could not eat. Threw the whole jar away, and I can't remember another time in my life that I threw something away because it was so distasteful.
customer_reviews.author: Rocky Mountaineer

customer_reviews.title: Happy purchase!!
customer_reviews.text: Exactly what we wanted!!! Smooth yummy almond butter ♡ I read some reviews where people didn't like the taste, said it was bland etc.. My family doesn't consume much sugars or have very salty foods. We thought this was exactly how fresh natural almonds should taste in this form. If your use to sweet peanut butter this isn't it. If your like my family who loves eating natural raw nuts try this! We received ours in great condition & no palm oil separation occured. Will now buy this brand from now on!
customer_reviews.author: Christina Jewell

customer_reviews.title: added oils--taste is really weak. Crunchy has added oil and sugar. NEVER AGAIN!!!!!
customer_reviews.text: I eat almond butter several times a week. Often Trader Joes brand and also Kirkland. Both those products only have ground almonds....NOTHING added. Barney's however may not have added sugar or salt (at least the smooth) but it has added palm fruit oil and the taste is completely diluted. Totally bland and gummy. Too complicated to return but never again. I also regrettably bought the crunchy and although I haven't tried it yet, it has added sugar. Really, who needs it.
customer_reviews.author: Stephanie

customer_reviews.title: Yuk! Gross! Horrible!
customer_reviews.text: Yuk! Gross! I guess I should've read the ingredients closer... After opening the jar and put in a knife, a big spew of oil flew out the top and out of the jar on to me and then counter like Old Spindle exploded. What a mess! This stuff can hardly be called almond butter in my opinion, as it hardly tastes like almonds as it's got so much palm oil, plus the taste and consistency is greasy, like shortening. It tasted terrible I threw it on the trash!
customer_reviews.author: yo

customer_reviews.title: Unacceptable ingrediants
customer_reviews.text: I can't believe that this company put palm oil and sugar in this almond butter. We all know that palm oil is not a sustainable product and are knowledgeable about the destruction of our tropical rain forests due to the harvesting of it. Poor orangutans as well. Why the added sugar? No one needs it. I tossed my plastic jar.
customer_reviews.author: Rachel McDonald

customer_reviews.title: Good
customer_reviews.text: Awesome stuff! Very smooth texture, spreads pretty easily if kept in a cabinet, and has a semi-sweet flavor. If I eat regular almond butter I occasionally have a mild reaction to the lectins in the skins. This blanched version has absolutely no noticeable effects on my wellbeing. I tried a few other brands. This one was my favorite.
customer_reviews.author: Mr. Wise

customer_reviews.title: Good for peanut allergies!
customer_reviews.text: Has good taste, a little spendy but it’s hard to find true almond butter that is “truely” PEANUT FREE and made in a peanut free facility for people who have severe allergies and what kid doesn’t want a peanut or almond butter and jelly sandwich now and again!! So yes it’s expensive but I’ll still buy it, we just don’t use it like crazy or eat it by the spoon like some people do with regular peanut butter!
customer_reviews.author: RNarmyMOM

customer_reviews.title: This stuff is vile.
customer_reviews.text: If I want to eat something that tastes like grass, I will go out and pluck some grass for free. It doesn't taste good, it doesn't spread, and it is way too expensive (even if I did care for the taste). The only good thing about it is that the dog will eat it for a treat so I didn't have to throw it out. I had someone else try it and they did not like it either so I couldn't even give it away.
customer_reviews.author: Mary E. Tatro

customer_reviews.title: MY NEW FAVORITE NUT BUTTER
customer_reviews.text: I love almond butter and have tried many of them. Some are too dry, some are really runny. This Barney crunchy almond butter is just right! Also, it is the nuttiest crunchiest that I've found, which is most important to me. I'm so happy with Barney, I won't be trying new ones any more. Perfection!
customer_reviews.author: CAShopR

customer_reviews.title: Great, if you love the taste of almonds!
customer_reviews.text: You have to really love the taste of almonds to enjoy this straight from the jar. It was really hard to stir by hand, but nothing my hand mixer couldn't tackle. I just attached one of the small dough hooks and the mixer made quick work of stirring the butter. I'm using the product as part of a recipe so the almond taste is basically masked. If I had intended to eat this "as is" I wouldn't have liked it. Again, you have to really like almonds to enjoy this.
customer_reviews.author: CDS

customer_reviews.title: Best almond butter out there - very smooth and good taste
customer_reviews.text: I switched from peanut butter to almond butter a couple years ago, and I've tried all the grocery store brands. This is easily the best, and it's what I buy regularly now. It's very smooth and nicely homogenized, so you get almost zero pooling of oil when it sits on the shelf. I suppose there are gourmet brands that taste better, but they are rarely well homogenized and so require a lot of work just to make a sandwich. This is the sweet spot for almond butter.
customer_reviews.author: Billy Hollis

customer_reviews.title: I love Barney Butter
customer_reviews.text: I love Barney Butter, but I gave it 3 stars because it came with a huge air bubble on the top and the butter tasted a little weird (not creamy and smooth, more like a paste). I found some at my local grocery store and there were no air bubbles and it was really smooth and delicious. So I will be buying from there from now on instead of from Amazon. ***side note*** I messaged Barney Butter online and they said they would alert the amazon team. So hopefully they will fix the problem for future buyers.
customer_reviews.author: Kendra

customer_reviews.title: My favorite almond butter
customer_reviews.text: I have tried about every brand of almond butter and this is by far my favorite one. I have tried to have this delivered twice and the quality is not the same as in the store. It is supposed to be a smooth no stir and when I got it from Amazon it was separated and needed to be mixed. I have tried this twice and it is the same thing. I will pay the extra money from the store to get the best quality.
customer_reviews.author: Ginger Welch

customer_reviews.title: Unsweetened Barney Almond Butter
customer_reviews.text: I am on a keto diet, and it is an excellent ingredient for my bulletproof coffee. I have to have it every morning, and I can eat it with celery as a snack. Great taste, it always come on time, and I will continue with my orders forever and ever. I highly recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Ruth

customer_reviews.title: Its good
customer_reviews.text: I am iron deficient and this was recommended by my friend. I have been using it for over 3 months and love it. I love the fact that is does not have any added sugar and just 2 major ingredients. The only problem is that the palm oil sometimes would float on top but thats now a major drawback.
customer_reviews.author: Annie

customer_reviews.title: Smooth like PB
customer_reviews.text: I have tried my share of almond butters and this one is the closest consistency to peanut butter. It's just as smooth as PB but definitely more dense. I usually get almond butter with a little salt, so for me this one is a little bland, but if it's what fits into you diet then it's a good option! I'll probably buy it again.
customer_reviews.author: HeyAliJayTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: Great taste
customer_reviews.text: Was really wonderful until someone got incredibly venal and more than tripled the price. 8.99 to 28.99, which I thought was a typo. I know you won't let this review go through, but I wonder who was the slime responsible---Barney or Amazon? p.s. see you've changed it back: thank you---I will subscribe once more, since I saw it had been jacked up and cancelled it.
customer_reviews.author: Erin Elizabeth Wright

customer_reviews.title: Didn't receive the same thing as Previous Order!
customer_reviews.text: My favorite. Love the texture. Not slimy like peanut butter, perfectly creamed. However, I have made this purchase before && when I went to my previous orders... I selected 2 16oz jars for $10.?? That is NOT what I received!!! I only received ONE of the jars.
customer_reviews.author: Francisco J Martinez

customer_reviews.title: When shopping anywhere, do your homework, research, browse.
customer_reviews.text: This product of Barney's peanut butter is misleading. I received it today and when I reached for item I was not happy☹ was actually surprised. I typed in peanut butter "by the bulk" I'm over here thinking that is a big huge jar or canister of straight peanut butter by the bulk! They take a picture real close up where the label of the jar takes up the whole screen, has people like myself thinking I am purchasing and receiving by the bulk. What a let-down and to top it off what I paid for it oh, I could have purchased 7 jars at that size , at that price, as the regular supermarket. Do your homework people . research
customer_reviews.author: rT

customer_reviews.title: Meh, it was ok, but not as "almondy" as I expected
customer_reviews.text: Unimpressed. It was very smooth, but also very thick and difficult to mix/ spread. This would probably be ok in a smoothie, but for my use in yogurt, I prefer a more fluid consistency. Also, this was... how to describe... Less "almondy" in flavor than other butters I've gotten? It really was a lot like smooth peanut butter with a light almond flavor. I'll take a slightly gritty, flavorful butter over this any day.
customer_reviews.author: Luke

customer_reviews.title: This has lots of sugar
customer_reviews.text: This item shows with other almond butters that are pure and sugar free. This has a high cane sugar content.
customer_reviews.author: K. Freda

customer_reviews.title: Smooth, delicious, peanut free
customer_reviews.text: Way better than Justins. Seems much closer to regular smooth peanut butter (I wouldn't know because of allergies). This stuff is great. Made in a peanut free facility, fair trade ingredients, and most importantly tasty.
customer_reviews.author: Bobby

customer_reviews.title: Best Taste Better Than Peanut Butter
customer_reviews.text: We weren't sure we were going to like Almond Butter. We absolutely love it! It has a richer yet lighter taste to it. It smells and tastes just like peanut butter. Almond butter is so much better for you. We are buying it on subscription now!
customer_reviews.author: Liz

customer_reviews.title: PERFECT!!!
customer_reviews.text: UHHH.... Let me just say, OMG!! that is all. Perfect, Almond Butter taste but with close to Peanut Butter consistency, like a thicker more paste like JIF. Only blanched almonds and palm fruit oil (which is actually NOT bad for you) My only question is how can a lot more RIGHT NOW!!
customer_reviews.author: Hilfy

customer_reviews.title: OMG!
customer_reviews.text: I have been eating almond butter for many years but really missed the crunchiness of JIF extra crunchy--until now, that is. This crunchy almond butter is fabulous. Yes, it's expensive but I love it and will keep ordering it.
customer_reviews.author: MWM

customer_reviews.title: The Only Almond Butter I Buy!
customer_reviews.text: Before I used to never buy almond butter because I though it was just nasty. But, after trying Barney's from a friend I have converted to this butter! I like how it is smooth with little crunchy pieces inside instead of just somewhat grainy throughout as with Justin's or Whole Foods almond butter. I actually recommend eating this by itself (I usually eat this with a spoon:) ), because when I tried spreading it on toast it didn't really taste like much anymore! I recommend this for people who like to eat nut butters by the spoon!
customer_reviews.author: CW

customer_reviews.title: Barney's is the best
customer_reviews.text: Barney's is the best! It's a little stiff, but the flavor and freshness is the best out there. It's not so oily as some, and if you just give it a good stir initially and work it out, the spreadability improves. :=). Good stuff!
customer_reviews.author: Kristina

customer_reviews.title: Best Almond Butter
customer_reviews.text: This is the best almond butter I have had! I have tried several brands and most are oily and will separate. This is smoothe and has great flavor. It is not the cheapest, but it is high quality and I love it!
customer_reviews.author: A. Jones

customer_reviews.title: So Thankful For This Find!
customer_reviews.text: I am not a big fan of almond butter. I purchased this to use in a keto cookie recipe, and it was perfect! I was worried about the cookies being too grainy, so I looked for an almond butter that was relatively smooth, and Barney Butter was it. The cookies were amazing, and most people had no idea they were "healthy" cookies because the flavor was out of this world!
customer_reviews.author: Christina

customer_reviews.title: CONTAINS PALM FRUIT OIL
customer_reviews.text: I specifically read all the nutrition labels looking for a product that only contained almonds. The "ingredient" section is omitted in the pictures of the jar. I did not want almond butter with PALM FRUIT OIL.
customer_reviews.author: Jan S.

customer_reviews.title: Love it!
customer_reviews.text: This is my favorite Almond butter. It's difficult to find almond butter locally that isn't processed in a facility that also produces soy or peanuts. This brand checks all my boxes and is delicious in my morning smoothies when I want some extra calories to get me started.
customer_reviews.author: Nicole Mead

customer_reviews.title: The best almond butter
customer_reviews.text: Our favorite almond butter. It is surprisingly difficult to find butters that don't have added sugar. We also face the difficult situation of having a household member allergic to peanuts and another allergic to cashews, so it is also difficult to find butters that don't risk cross contamination-this company focuses on almonds only, and we appreciate it. This company also has excellent customer service. Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Matt Hedberg

customer_reviews.title: Creamy almond butter
customer_reviews.text: I love this almond butter. It doesn’t have the distinct almond-ish flavor that the almond skin imparts to regular ground almond butter. It is milder and has a light nutty flavor. It is creamy and I kind that it doesn’t have added sugar.
customer_reviews.author: Heaston

customer_reviews.title: Extremely smooth and creamy
customer_reviews.text: We’ve recently joined the keto craze. The Skippy peanut butter we used to use is no longer going to cut it. We tried an almond butter brand from Costco and it was absolutely horrible!! Watched a YouTube video on keto and the lady was using this Barney butter and highly recommended it. Thought we’d give it a try. So glad we did! It’s awesome!
customer_reviews.author: This is my public name.

customer_reviews.title: Has replaced peanut butter for me 😊👍🏻
customer_reviews.text: My go to for almond butter!! It has replaced peanut butter, and It doesn't have traces of peanuts or cashews either like some other brands (I'm allergic to cashews) I LOVE that it has no added sugar or salt. Not everyone would be thrilled with that BUT for anyone watching their salt and sugar intake, and avoiding peanut butter, then this is perfect 😊 PLUS the container is bpa free and recyclable ♻️
customer_reviews.author: lucia lopez

customer_reviews.title: Great Taste & Perfect for Peanut Allergies
customer_reviews.text: One of the only Almond Butters that are not only good for anyone with a Peanut Allergy (made in a Peanut Free Facility) but also great taste! Unlike some Almond butters that need to be stirred over and over again, this one just needs a good stirring once. And if you let it sit overnight (or 2) upside down, the stirring is even easier.
customer_reviews.author: Danie

customer_reviews.title: My favorite!
customer_reviews.text: This is my favorite brand of almond butter. It is super smooth and doesn't have the grainy texture alot of the others have. It also doesn't separate, so you dont have to stir it for a million years before making a sandwich.
customer_reviews.author: Heyitsme

product_meta.title: BARNEY Almond Butter, Bare Smooth, No Stir, No Sugar, No Salt, Non-GMO, Skin-Free, Paleo, KETO, 16 Ounce
product_meta.description: Flavor:Bare Smooth| Size:16 Ounce (Pack of 1)OK, let’s say you love the texture and quality of Barney Butter, but you quit sugar or your doctor banned sodium from your diet. The “Bares” are for you. Enjoy the same Barney texture and quality without the added sugar or salt. The “Bares” are also a great addition to other foods that may already have sugar or salt (smoothies, cookies, ice cream, oatmeal, sauces, etc.).At Barney we believe in the almighty almond and think they are the perfect food. We start with the highest grade and quality almond you can get and then we make it even better than you thought possible by removing the skin. Extra smooth, no grittiness and no bitterness. You just have to taste the difference.
feature_bullets: SKIN-FREE, CALIFORNIA ALMONDS – We blanch premium California almonds to remove the skin to produce an ultra-smooth, no-stir, grit-free texture
BARE ESSENTIALS - Only two ingredients; the same great taste without added sugar or salt
NON-GMO - Our small-batch blends use only the finest ingredients
ALLERGEN FREE – Peanut-Free, Gluten-Free, Soy-Free, Dairy-Free, Egg-Free
FITS YOUR LIFESTYLE - Clean eating plant based protein that is certified Paleo, KETO, Vegan and Kosher

specifications.Domestic Shipping: Currently, item can be shipped only within the U.S. and to APO/FPO addresses. For APO/FPO shipments, please check with the manufacturer regarding warranty and support issues.
specifications.International Shipping: This item can be shipped to select countries outside of the U.S.

Average customer reviews has a small extra line on hover* https://omni-grok.amazon.com/xref/src/appgroup/websiteTemplates/retail/SoftlinesDetailPageAssets/udp-intl-lock/src/legacy.css?indexName=WebsiteTemplates#40*/.noUnderline a:hover {text-decoration: none;}
